oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carol funds provide equipment at Day Home, circa 1951 December 14
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph taken at the Fannie Battle Day Home, circa 14 December 1951. Pictured left to right, is Mrs. Drowota, president of the Fannie Battle Social Workers, Mrs. Corinne Pilcher, director of the home, Mrs. T. Graham Hall and Mrs. Avery Handly, viewing a refrigerator-freezer, some of the "modern equipment" acquired through funds raised for the Day Home by the Christmas Eve program of carol singing. This Nashville and Davidson County tradition was inaugurated more than three decades earlier, with Mrs. Hall the first chairman and Mrs. Handly, her assistant. This photograph illustrated the newspaper article "Carol funds provide equipment at Day Home," in the 14 December 1951 issue of the Nashville Banner. Forms part of the Fannie Battle Day Home Records. 1 photograph : b & w ; 10 x 8.25 in.
